channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024080978
item.description:
Report X-2024080978

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the INDH location a fiberboard box was dropped during the loading process. The fiberboard box contained six plastic bottles in a plastic bag. One of the plastic bottles was punctured on the bottom causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024080409
item.description:
Report E-2024080409

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 2-ounces of Dynachlor released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to the bung caps being loose. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who declined assistance and cleaned the spill with terminal-issued PPE. The caps were tightened and the drum was shipped forward.

item.title: Report X-2024080866
item.description:
Report X-2024080866

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was given to the INDH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered that two of the metal cans inside had spilled in the fiberboard box. The cans were packaged in a plastic bag with vermiculite. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024080859
item.description:
Report X-2024080859

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Aug 6th during the AM sort a package was found with a strong odor. The package was marked as UN1263 Paint, 3, PGIII, further investigation showed that there are 2 drums in the overpacka and that one of the drums did develop a leak at the bottom chime allowing a small amount of liquid to escape. The package was placed into a salvage drum and is pending disposition.

item.title: Report I-2024070114
item.description:
Report I-2024070114

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: EAST CHICAGO
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TRADEBE TRANSPORTATION LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On July 24, 2024 a Tradebe Transportation driver made a customer pickup at the customer's location: Chem Processing INC, 3910 Linden Oaks Drive, Rockford, IL. After the driver returned to Tradebe Treatment and Recycling at 4343 Kennedy Avenue, East Chicago, IN the receiving supervisor noted that one of the totes was empty and that 200-250 gallons of material in the tote was released, It was determined that the material loaded in behind the tote shifted in transit and damaged the bottom valve causing the material to spill. The overall root cause was that the load was not blocked and braced properly.

item.title: Report E-2024080286
item.description:
Report E-2024080286

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: FORT WAYNE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that half-a-pound (0.5) pound of material was released. Clean Harbors personnel moved all the plastic bags from the pallet to verify only five (5) bags were damaged and then swept up the released material. The damaged bags and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums and one (1) 5-gallon poly drum and were staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.
